Job Title: Principal Back End Software Engineer - Dell Finance Services
Job Description:
Principal Back End Software Engineer - Dell Finance Services
Join us as a Principal Back End Software Engineer on our Dell Finance Services team in Brazil to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.
What you’ll achieve
Dell Financial Services is seeking talented Backend Software Engineers to join our energetic, fast-paced environment. You will be working with a globally distributed team on mainly moving legacy applications to your micro services echo system in our private Pivotal Cloud Foundry instance as well supporting our legacy systems. Our Software Engineers are responsible for designing, coding, testing, debugging, documenting and supporting .Net Core PCF applications. Our complex financial systems range from development of consumer and internal facing web based applications, to internal batch processing systems and the new Cloud systems.
You will:
Drive and push the usage of new technologies and how to properly apply them within DFS ecosystem
Partner with architects across the organization to bring ideas to live and solution complex problems
Solve architectural and technical challenges by developing and enhancing a core product in C# using .net core
Take dev ownership and have the opportunity to support it through all its engineering lifecycle
Interact with a global and fun team, exchanging experiences and collaborating in support to business growth
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements
Solid knowledge of at least one modern object oriented programming language, e.g., C#, Java, Python. And its related tools, ecosystem and best practices.
Experience with Microservices architecture, REST APIs, libraries or utilities, and one PaaS or IaaS platform such as AWS, GCP, Azure or PCF.
Experience with .net core and asp.net core development with proven Open-Source contributions
Expert in DevOps practices
Strong English communication skills.
Desirable Requirements
Experience with Messaging Systems. e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka.
Experience with document oriented NoSQL DBs. e.g., MongoDB, CouchDB.

CI&T is your end-to-end digital transformation partner. As a digital native, we bring a 25-year track record of accelerating business impact through complete and scalable digital solutions. With a global presence of more than 3,300 professionals in strategy, research, data science, design and engineering, we unlock top-line growth, improve customer experience and drive operational efficiency.

General Description:
We are looking for scientists who are passionate for data and are eager to tackle big challenges using Data Science and Machine Learning. The main focus of this role is to solve non-trivial business problems in Fortune 500 companies. This person will mostly work with a mix of structured and unstructured, and use scientific methods and state-of-the-art techniques and tools to help our customers achieve their business objectives.

Responsibilities:
Understand complex business problems and translate them into structured data problems.
Capture and explore complex data sets (structured and unstructured data).
Prototype Model of different complexity (business analysis, statistical models, machine learning) using modern data science tools (Notebooks, Clouds).
Design and implementation of machine learning models, metrics and application of feature engineering techniques applied to customers problems.
Conduct descriptive analysis, demand forecasting models, product purchase recommendation models and optimization models to maximize sales volume and margin;
Support pre-sales in business opportunities and the engineering teams in the implementation of production-ready solutions involving machine learning.
Evaluate hypotheses and the impact of machine learning algorithms on key business metrics. Simulations and offline/online experimentation (via A/B tests) is part of the game.
Research and understand user behavior patterns, such as user engagement and segmentation, using machine learning models, to help test hypotheses.
Communicate findings effectively to an audience of engineers and executives.

Required qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Applied Math, Statistics, Physics or other related quantitative areas.
Ability to understand mathematical models and algorithms in research papers, and to implement them into running software for Proof-of-Concepts and projects.
Ability to explore big data without a specific problem defined, in order to come up with the right questions and provide interesting findings.
Proficient in computer languages like Python, R and SQL, making use of the best frameworks for machine learning pipelines, data visualization, manipulation and transforming, models training and evaluation, and models deployment.
Experience with common feature engineering techniques and machine learning algorithms for Supervised and Unsupervised Learning, like Regression, Classification, Clustering, Dimensionality Reduction, Association Rules, Ranking and Recommender Systems.
Business sense and consulting behaviour to identify and breakdown problems, define and evaluate hypothesis.
Think critically and act in a detail-oriented fashion while keeping the "big picture" in mind.
Ability to provide creative and innovative approaches to problem solving.
Ability to work independently and within a collaborative team environment.
Advanced oral and written communication skills in English.

Desired qualifications:
Masters or PhD in Machine Learning / Data Mining / Statistics.
Experience with Bayesian and statistical methods.
Experience with Platforms for Big Data processing (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, BigQuery), Cloud Platforms and Data Viz tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, R-shiny, Bokeh, D3.js).
Experience in agile methods, software engineering techniques (e.g. unit testing, refactoring, version control), design of solution architectures and software product development.

#MidSenior
#LI-NA1

CI&T is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We are actively seeking to diversify our team and build an inclusive environment where everyone feels like they belong.

QUALIFICATIONS
Undergraduate degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, information systems or related field
Up to 3 years of relevant professional work experience in a data engineering function or with a reputed analytics firm
Experience in the field of collections and /or business intelligence are a plus
Experience with dashboarding (Domo, Power BI, Tableau) will be a plus
Strong coding knowledge in SQL, medium in T-SQL and Python is required; capability in the field of large data handling through one or combination of the following: Snaplogic, Talend ,Alteryx is a plus
Understanding of data warehousing and data lake concepts, experience in building operational ETL data pipelines across a number of sources, and constructing relational and dimensional data models
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server would be an advantage
Basic knowledge of version control systems (git) is a plus
Solid problem-solving capabilities, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root causes and recommend solutions
Strong interpersonal, written/verbal communications skills in English
Willingness to travel (~30% of time)
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You will join the Sao Paulo office and work with the C-Insights Solution team. You will support the development of cutting edge technology assets that will help banks, retailers, telecom and utility clients be more efficient and effective in customer assistance and loss mitigation. The solution that will be deployed at clients that will leverage advanced analytics, machine learning, full stack development and data visualization capabilities to give cutting edge technology tools to our Risk practice clients around the world.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will help build products that leverage client data on collections to enable development and deployment of enhanced analytical models.
In this role, you will be responsible for the technical deployment of the solution at the client, including integration with client systems, database structuring, back-end customizations, and ongoing maintenance. Your work will combine ‘Agile’ with expertise in cloud and big data to help create, deploy and maintain custom solutions that helps clients increase productivity and make timely decisions.
Lastly, you will collaborate with the C-Insights Solution team of product managers, developers and technical operations firm members to design, develop and implement IT cloud-based solutions, systems and processes in order to automate provisioning, quality controls, security auditing and maintenance of the solution.

Job Title: Principal Software Engineer – AI ML Platform Engineering
Job Description:
Principal Software Engineer – AI ML Platform Engineering


Join us as a Principal Software Engineer on our AI ML Platform Software Engineering team in Brazil to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve


Our AI ML Platform Software Engineering team is spearheading Dell’s Digital Transformation by driving innovation in the way we deliver advanced AI and ML technologies that can help our business units deliver improvements across our entire customer experience and optimize our business outcomes. We design and develop software with the most advanced technologies, tools, software engineering methodologies and the collaboration of internal and external partners. This position will merge software engineering, modern dev ops, data engineering and deployment at scale to help teams deploy algorithmic models that can optimize business and customer experiences at scale. The candidate will use technical knowledge and software development to build technology centric solutions that accelerate the development of AI and ML capabilities across the company.

You will:


- Software design and development for internal and external customer products.

- Utilize a range of applicable technologies (e.g., programming languages, compilers, assemblers, debuggers, other tools) for products used in local, networked, storage enhancements and/or new systems.

- Implements system security to provide stable and secure systems platforms.

- Participates in product development in all stages from planning and design to development, testing and documentation.

- Develops high availability and highly scalable applications which will be used by both internal and external customers.

Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Requirements:


- Solid experience in a professional role with a Bachelor’s degree

- Demonstrated experience writing and maintaining high quality code as well as documentation

- Demonstrated experience with object-oriented programming languages such as C# or Java

- Experience with cloud-native computing, cloud platforms, microservices architecture, modern DevOps, Test Driven Development and Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment.

- Experience with Kubernetes, Docker, Functions, elastic compute, enterprise-scale platforms, parallelized workloads, real-time data streams, open source frameworks.

Desirable Requirements:

- Master's degree

Here’s our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Application closing date: 20 March 2021.

Here’s our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Application closing date: 20 March 2021.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Employment Opportunity Policy here.

QUALIFICATIONS
BSc degree (between july 2019 - december 2021) in Computer Science or Engineering or related fields
Basic foundations in Software Engineering, Agile and Cloud computing
Programming skills in at least 2 of the following languages: SQL, Python, Scala, Java
Good knowledge in relational databases such as PostgreSQL and MySQL
Basic foundations in Big Data platforms both for batch and streaming data processing like Hadoop Ecosystem, Spark, Kafka
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization
Ability to communicate ideas most effectively - both verbally and in writing - in English
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You’ll work in our São Paulo office as part of our Advanced Analytics Apprenticeship program within our QuantumBlack team.
As an Apprentice Data Engineer at QuantumBlack, you will work with other Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Designers and Project Managers on interdisciplinary projects, using Maths, Stats and Machine Learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.
You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm. You’ll work with colleagues from across the firm to help our clients launch agile marketing and personalization programs at scale, enabled by data and technology. You’ll have the opportunity to plug into exciting large scale marketing and digital transformations.
While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own OSS called Kedro, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure and more!
Our office culture is casual and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally.
You will help to design and build data pipelines to support data science projects, following software engineering best practices. You will use state of the art technologies to acquire, ingest, and transform big datasets.
You will help to map data fields to hypotheses and curate, wrangle, and prepare data for use in advanced analytics model. You will help to create and manage data environments in the Cloud or on premise
Please submit your CV in English
As an equal opportunity employer, QuantumBlack encourages applications from all backgrounds regardless of gender, race, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief. We maintain a sense of community rooted in respect and consideration for all employees where any evaluation is based simply upon individual work and team performance.

Procuramos um Engenheiro de Dados Pleno que será responsável por auxiliar nosso time de Data & Analytics a elevar a operação de patamar e de quebra, contribuir ativamente para o crescimento do nosso negócio.

Estamos em fase de expansão e crescimento acelerado, por isso precisamos de alguém que esteja disposto a fazer a diferença e contribuir para que os processos de ETL funcionem com excelência, trazendo insumos para tomada de decisão estratégica baseadas em dados.

É importante ter sólida vivência na área de dados, tendo atuado com banco de dados e ferramentas Self Service, plataformas cloud e servless.

Se você curte desafios, tem ambição de ser protagonista dentro de um ambiente dinâmico e ágil, com crescimento exponencial, o digio é o seu lugar!


Main responsibilities

Contribuir para o design da arquitetura de dados, modelos de dados e esquemas de tabelas.
Planejar e implementar melhorias nos processos visando: melhorar o monitoramento dos processos, melhorar a performance de extrações e transformação de dados e tornar o ambiente mais tolerante a falhas.
Construir e manter os processos/rotinas de ingestão e tratamento de dados em múltiplas fontes (ex.: Bancos de Dados, arquivos TXT e streaming de dados)
Desenhar, desenvolver e implementar soluções com dados para suportar atividades de Business Intelligence and Business Analytics.

Requirements and skills

Bacharel em Engenharia de Software, Ciência da Computação e ou Ciências Exatas. Pós Graduação em áreas correlatas a engenharia de software ou bancos dados ou sistemas de informação.
Outras formações podem ser consideradas mediante comprovação de experiência com a função
3 a 8 anos de experiência na construção de Data Warehouses, Data Lakes, Data Marts e tabelas para suportar sistemas de informação
1 a 3 anos de experiência com desenvolvimento em Python/PySpark
1 a 3 anos de experiência com computação em nuvem: AWS, Google ou Azure.
1 a 2 anos de experiência no levantamento de requisitos funcionais para a construção de indicadores de negócio
1 a 3 anos de experiência na construção de ETL em Bancos de Dados
1 a 3 anos de experiência na construção de ETL para arquivos csv, txt, json e parquet.
Forte conhecimento em linguagens programação, especialmente Python, PySpark e SQL.
Conhecer os componentes da AWS: Cloud Formation, IAM, S3, RDS, lambda, EMR, Athena, Glue and Firehouse.
Ser familiarizado com práticas ágeis: kanban e scrum
Ser familiarizado com ferramentas de controle de versão de software: Githut, Bitbucket, etc.
Conhecimento básico de Hadoop/Big Data.

Somos o digio

O digio é uma plataforma digital de serviços financeiros que apresenta diversos produtos para consumidores finais e empresas.

Lançado em 2016, o cartão de crédito com gestão por aplicativo foi seu primeiro produto. O app conta com uma loja própria– a digioStore com produtos de recarga de celular, e-Gifts, seguros, entre outros – e um clube de fidelidade de acúmulo de pontos e cashback – o digioClub –. Ainda, o digio conta com um produto de empréstimos pessoais por meio de uma plataforma digital, paperless e completamente segura.

Sua proposta de valor é ser uma plataforma agnóstica de serviços financeiros com a solidez dos bancos e agilidade das fintechs.”

We believe that learning a language should be fun, rewarding, and a gateway to the best experiences life has to offer. If you agree, we'd love to talk.

If you are a software engineer looking to use your talent in teaching the world English, take a look at Voxy. Voxy software engineers will change the way millions of people around the world learn English by using sound science combined with innovative (and patented!) technology. We are implementing research-driven learning activities coupled with live streaming for topic-based live tutoring sessions using advanced algorithms to build a customized experience using authentic content sources from names you know (Bloomberg, AP, Financial Times and more.). Voxy's goal is to become THE vendor of first choice in the $80 billion dollar English language education market and our development team will be instrumental in reaching this goal.

What You'll Be Doing:
Build nicely-instrumented code that is testable and deployable without downtime
Evolve our big data pipeline to use real time feedback for an optimal platform for learners
Design a best in breed application that is enjoyable to work with, performant to our partners, and evolves with our learners
Scale the Voxy application and make it ready for feeding our upcoming projects in NLP and machine learning
What We're Looking For:
3+ years of experience working as a software developer
Curiosity and knowledge about technologies and architectural patterns of software engineering across the entire stack
Pragmatism in understanding when to build the solution that scales to 1 million users or works for 100 users
Ability to design data models that reflect the Voxy business using advanced SQL/NoSQL/ORM's
What Would Be Nice To Have:
Django or Django Rest Framework
AWS and devops
B.S. or higher in computer science, science or engineering discipline or equivalent experience
Working here, you'll enjoy:
Competitive salary and stock options
Great benefits: medical insurance, cell phone & wifi reimbursement, home office & wellness budget, team events
Remote friendly work policies
Professional development budget
Language classes w/ Voxy
Work with an awesome international team of super bright, creative, talented, and passionate individuals based in the U.S. and globally
Voxy Engineering Team's Values:
Trust
We trust our colleagues by respecting their decisions and opinions to collaborate effectively, do the right thing and maintain good working relationships.
Open Communication:
Communicate openly by sharing our thoughts (pros & cons), being outspoken, having important decisions written down for the entire team, and staying in touch with the rest of Voxy outside Engineering to ensure that the team is on the same page and build & increase trust both within the engineering team and within Voxy.
Pragmatism
Consider the impact of our choices to find an effective way to solve a problem.
Engineers Help Design the Product
Actively direct the product to design elegant features at the early stages of the design process as well as continue to improve the design when we work on them.
>>You can read more about the Voxy Engineering Team's values in an article written by Iswarya Parupudi, Co-Director of Engineering at Voxy. See link here.

Want to know more about us?

Voxy is a U.S. - based company that is changing the way the world learns English. Our proprietary personalization technology and exclusive partnerships with leading content publishers enable us to deliver a one-of-a-kind solution to over 2.5 million English learners across the globe. Our mobile and web applications make it possible for individuals to learn from the world around them, turning everyday experiences and content into fun, game-like activities. Our custom-built, live one-on-one tutoring platform brings the necessary human element front and center, and is a core piece of our methodology. Voxy's disruption of the $80B market for English language education has been recognized by leading education investors and the company has been deemed a pioneer by The New York Times, CNN Money, Fast Company, Mashable, Univision, Veja (Brazil), Venturebeat, and others.

About IP Optical Networks

Our IP/Optical Networks business group (ION) includes IP, optical and network automation technologies and related services sold to our communication service provider customers as well as adjacent markets including webscale companies and enterprises. Our comprehensive wide area networking (WAN) solutions enable our customers to build and operate automated, secure, and high-performance networks at massive scale – helping to interconnect people and things from any broadband access modality to – and among - edge clouds, central clouds, the Internet, and other services and data centers.

Job Responsibilities & Competencies

Developing front end website architecture.
Designing user interactions on web pages.
Developing back end website applications.
Creating servers and databases for functionality.
Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.
Ensuring responsiveness of applications.
Working alongside graphic designers for web design features.
Seeing through a project from conception to finished product.
Designing and developing APIs.
Meeting both technical and consumer needs.
Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.
Technical leadership role for the creation of a network automation discipline and standards across the global network in all networking contexts.
Serve as the firm-wide technical expert in network automation and programming.
Qualifications

We are looking for a highly skilled computer programmer who is comfortable with both front and back end programming. The focus is on automation of document generation and provision scripts for network nodes such as routers, firewalls, DNS, SAEGW, MME, etc.

Full Stack Developers are responsible for developing and designing front end web architecture, ensuring the responsiveness of applications and working alongside graphic designers for web design features, among other duties.

Full Stack Developers will be required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring good organizational skills and attention to detail.

Full Stack Developer Requirements:
Degree in Computer, Electronics, Telecommunications Engineering or equivalent.
Minimum of 7 years experience in Web Development
Strong organizational and project management skills.
Proficiency with fundamental front end languages such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
Proficiency with Git
Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as Vue and React.
Proficiency with server side languages such as Python and NodeJS. (Django or FastAPI framework knowledge is preferred)
Familiarity with database technology such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Good problem solving skills.
Attention to detail.

Cheesecake Labs is a software design and engineering partner that builds tech products.
With locations in California and Brazil, we have been building apps since 2013. We know the process and empower a multidisciplinary team of 60+ designers, engineers, and project managers to deliver delightful solutions.
If you’re an enthusiastic, talented, and resourceful Software engineer with the relevant skills & IT experience, let's talk about creating disruptive products, with an international and multidisciplinary team.
We offer home office policy, health & dental care, career plan, meal allowance, Profit Share Program (PPLR), Gympass, flexible working time, additional benefits (massage, yoga, English classes, nutritionist, parking lot, fuel assistance, psychotherapy, and education allowance), videogames, library, scooter, hoverboard, above-average salary, events and courses budget, 24/7 snacks, beers, and a unique work environment.
Cheesecake Labs continues to hire for all open roles, all interviewing and onboarding are done virtually due to COVID-19. Everyone new to the team and our current staff will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our office.
Some activities you would do on a typical day at Cheesecake Labs
Develop and maintain Web applications
Interact with other teams and professionals, including other developers, designers, project managers, and stakeholders
Create outstanding front-end interfaces
Make sure the application has a great user experience
Assist in the creation and implement mockups
Develop and maintain Backend solutions using Django, NodeJS
Build docker images that can run on top of AWS or other PaaS
Model databases using MySQL, Postgres, DynamoDB
Write beautiful, readable, and scalable code
Review the code of other developers
Make sure the application solves real-world problems
Understand the needs of our partners and come up with solutions for their problems
Participate in Sprint Plannings and daily stand-up meetings
Build estimates and plan roadmaps
In order to succeed, you'll likely need the following skills
Experience with Javascript, CSS, and HTML
Experience with ReactJS, React Native, and/or other Single Page Application libraries
Experience with Git
Experience with RESTful backend applications, specially built with Django
Experience with deployment processes using Docker, CircleCI, AWS, Heroku
Experience with different databases
Experience with UNIX systems and terminal
Knowledge about clean code, design patterns, and reactive programming
Knowledge about basic design principles
Being self-taught
Being up-to-date with the latest news and technologies about Frontend and Backend
English proficiency
Good communication skills, both in verbal and writing
This is a full-time position located in our cool Florianopolis/SC office.

TO has an opening for an Engineer in the area of Machine Learning (ML). We are looking for engineers who are passionate about Machine Learning and want to make an impact by creating ML solutions that completely change how HP does business today. The engineer will work with a very talented team towards the development of ML solutions that impact Commercial, Finance, and many other different organizations inside HP, collaborating with teams across the globe.

Applies developed subject matter knowledge to solve common and complex business issues within established guidelines and recommends appropriate alternatives. Works on problems of diverse complexity and scope. May act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process. Exercises independent judgment within generally defined policies and practices to identify and select a solution. Ability to handle most unique situations. May seek advice in order to make decisions on complex business issues.

Responsibilities:
Develops and programs integrated software solutions, especially in support of the development, deployment and life cycle of machine learning models.
Applies machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to business or research problems. Collects and analyzes data sources; develops, trains and evaluates models; creates visualizations of data properties and model performance. Deploys and maintains models
Keeps knowledge and skills current by reading state of the art research papers and blog posts from industry and research labs. Studies new methods to understanding industry trends and emerging technologies.
Knowledge and skills:
Fluent in one or more Machine Learning Frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, etc). Fluent in Python and knowledge of one or more additional programming Languages, such as C++, R, C#
Knowledge of modern computer science including algorithms, data structures, software architecture. Where applicable, knowledge of cloud and hybrid cloud service architectures and their impacts on development and deployment
Knowledge of the Mathematics of Machine Learning (particularly Linear Algebra, differential calculus) and Statistics
Deep understanding of current machine learning algorithms, under which circumstances each is applicable and their pros and cons.
Knowledge of data processing techniques and data preprocessing requirements for the common machine learning approaches. Knowledge of data collection techniques. Knowledge of data augmentation approaches and their pros and cons
2-4 years experience
Good balance between Software and ML, being able to navigate both areas properly.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language. Ability to effectively communicate product architectures, design proposals and negotiate options at management levels.
Passionate about learning new technologies and sharing knowledge with the team.
Desired qualifications include:
Experience with recent ML Ops tools and solutions for development and deployment of ML solutions.
Experience with time series forecasting with statistical and Machine Learning methods.
Familiarity with agile development processes.

_ Our business


Through technology (mobile, AI, automation, IOT), we have created a next-generation logistics network and we are, in an unprecedented way, positioning ourselves to unleash the growth of a new trade in Brazil with a fast, cost-effective and reliable logistics solution.

By the end of 2021, we want to be present in all Brazilian cities and reach the milestone of 5 million deliveries per day by 2025.

With SoftBank, Microsoft, GGV Capital and others, the new investment round has brought Loggi’s valuation up to US$1 billion hitting the unicorn mark!

“Our mission is to deliver everything to everyone everywhere as quickly as possible. We want to connect Brazil and value, for example, Amazonian handicrafts, enabling artisans to sell without intermediaries to consumers in any region.” (Fabien Mendez, CEO - Chief Executive Officer)

_ Our Engineering team


Loggi’s engineering team is focused on solving highly complex problems, mixing up very experienced professionals and early career employees, in a fortified environment by learning, sharing of experiences and respect. Together, we will build the logistics network of the country, developing unique algorithms, systems and processes.

Our leaders have already left their mark in the national and worldwide tech scenario, working in companies like Google and UOL. They are engaged in finding how to develop a group of more than a thousand programmers to explore the knowledge borders and connect the country.

We believe and invest in everyone's potential:

"Over the next 5 years we want to train Brazil’s future CTOs! Here, we have a structured development program." (Davi Reis, CTO - Chief Technology Officer)

Requirements

_ Responsibilities


You will architect and develop scalable solutions through data, being part of multidisciplinare squads seeking an amazing and efficient experience for the users! We will count on you to structure relevant data pipelines that support decision making and to make sure that the teams have access to high quality data information.

Loggi’s data team works with a wide variety of technologies and techniques to solve our challenges. We try to see beyond the buzzwords to develop solutions in a pragmatic and efficient way.

To spark your curiosity, we work with predictive models trained with sklearn and keras/tensorflow; algorithms of optimization based on or-tools, Systems in Azure and AWS, with and without kubernetes. In addition we also use Looker and ELK for dashboards and analysis.

Above everything, we expect desire and the ability to acquire knowledge and learn fast.

_ Requirements
6+ years of relevant work experience in Data Analytics;
Experience with Machine Learning techniques, Data Mining, and Statistical Data Analysis;
Experience with design and analysis of experiments;
Strong analytical and storytelling skills;
Collaborative profile, to work with other data analysts, engineers, product managers, and designers;
Familiarity with agile trends;
Leadership skills (previous experience working as a team lead/manager is a plus);
Experience in the academic field is a plus;
Interest in learning more about logistics.
Benefits

_ Our benefits


For a healthier life, we provide you:

Health plan with national coverage (without discounts!)
Dental plan (also without discounts!)
Flexible hours with the possibility of working at home according to function and demand
Discounts of up to 75% in gyms all over Brazil
Fresh fruit every day at the office

We support you with:

Above average remuneration of the best technology companies in Brazil, with annual reviews
Eligibility for Stock Options
Meal voucher and transportation voucher with symbolic discount of R$ 1
Possibility of payroll loan after 3 months of company

We develop you with:

US$ 3,300 for technical development per year
Immersion week in all areas of the company, our famous Xboarding
Frequent knowledge exchanges with internal and external professionals
Individual development plan updated every six months
Feedback culture and opportunity to work according to the squad concept
Working with big names in the history of technology in Brazil
Possibility to develop new algorithms with the challenge of creating the new generation of logistics

We help parents with:

Health and dental plan for children at no extra cost
6-month maternity leave and 20-day paternity leave
Daycare allowance of R$ 457 per child up to 5 years of age

Some of our offices also have:

Massage, manicure, pedicure at reduced costs
Pet day
Game rooms with video games, pool and others
Locker room and spaces to store your bike or scooter safely
Marketplace selling quick meals, drinks and snacks

_ Our culture


Inclusive, determined and visionary: that's who we are and how we work here.

We are already more than 1000 Loggers. We are hi-tech, little conservative and we are always up to date! Above all, we hope that everyone is eager to learn and acquire new knowledge quickly.

We look for an increasingly inspiring and welcoming work environment, and we very much hope that you will help us to maintain our culture even at an accelerated pace of growth.

We are very happy to be recognized among the best startups to work according to LinkedIn and Glassdoor, among the 10 most innovative startups by Forbes Brasil and also to be certified by Great Place to Work.

Being part of Loggi must mean that you can be who you are - or want to be. We look for a more accessible country. Thus, we can say that respecting the needs of different people is our reason for existing. This is history, it is culture, it is respect.

Important: All Loggi jobs are also open to people with disabilities (PwD).

This job description is written in English because we already have a technology office in Europe, and as we are hiring professionals from all over the world, you can have interactions with professionals who do not speak Portuguese.

Essa descrição de vaga está escrita em Inglês porque nós já temos um escritório de tecnologia na Europa e, como estamos contratando profissionais de todo o mundo, você pode ter interações com profissionais que não falam Português.

Let's go together?

_ Our business


Through technology (mobile, AI, automation, IOT), we have created a next-generation logistics network and we are, in an unprecedented way, positioning ourselves to unleash the growth of a new trade in Brazil with a fast, cost-effective and reliable logistics solution.

By the end of 2021, we want to be present in all Brazilian cities and reach the milestone of 5 million deliveries per day by 2025.

With SoftBank, Microsoft, GGV Capital and others, the new investment round has brought Loggi’s valuation up to US$1 billion hitting the unicorn mark!

“Our mission is to deliver everything to everyone everywhere as quickly as possible. We want to connect Brazil and value, for example, Amazonian handicrafts, enabling artisans to sell without intermediaries to consumers in any region.” (Fabien Mendez, CEO - Chief Executive Officer)

_ Our Engineering team


Loggi’s engineering team is focused on solving highly complex problems, mixing up very experienced professionals and early career employees, in a fortified environment by learning, sharing of experiences and respect. Together, we will build the logistics network of the country, developing unique algorithms, systems and processes.

Our leaders have already left their mark in the national and worldwide tech scenario, working in companies like Google and UOL. They are engaged in finding how to develop a group of more than a thousand programmers to explore the knowledge borders and connect the country.

We believe and invest in everyone's potential:

"Over the next 5 years we want to train Brazil’s future CTOs! Here, we have a structured development program." (Davi Reis, CTO - Chief Technology Officer)

Requirements

_ Responsibilities


You will architect and develop scalable solutions through data, being part of multidisciplinare squads seeking an amazing and efficient experience for the users! We will count on you to structure relevant data pipelines that support decision making and to make sure that the teams have access to high quality data information.

Loggi’s data team works with a wide variety of technologies and techniques to solve our challenges. We try to see beyond the buzzwords to develop solutions in a pragmatic and efficient way.

To spark your curiosity, we work with predictive models trained with sklearn and keras/tensorflow; algorithms of optimization based on or-tools, Systems in Azure and AWS, with and without kubernetes. In addition we also use Looker and ELK for dashboards and analysis.

Above everything, we expect desire and the ability to acquire knowledge and learn fast.

_ Requirements
6+ years of relevant work experience in Data Analytics;
Experience with Machine Learning techniques, Data Mining, and Statistical Data Analysis;
Experience with design and analysis of experiments;
Strong analytical and storytelling skills;
Collaborative profile, to work with other data analysts, engineers, product managers, and designers;
Familiarity with agile trends;
Leadership skills (previous experience working as a team lead/manager is a plus);
Experience in the academic field is a plus;
Interest in learning more about logistics.
Benefits

_ Our benefits


For a healthier life, we provide you:

Health plan with national coverage (without discounts!)
Dental plan (also without discounts!)
Flexible hours with the possibility of working at home according to function and demand
Discounts of up to 75% in gyms all over Brazil
Fresh fruit every day at the office

We support you with:

Above average remuneration of the best technology companies in Brazil, with annual reviews
Eligibility for Stock Options
Meal voucher and transportation voucher with symbolic discount of R$ 1
Possibility of payroll loan after 3 months of company

We develop you with:

US$ 3,300 for technical development per year
Immersion week in all areas of the company, our famous Xboarding
Frequent knowledge exchanges with internal and external professionals
Individual development plan updated every six months
Feedback culture and opportunity to work according to the squad concept
Working with big names in the history of technology in Brazil
Possibility to develop new algorithms with the challenge of creating the new generation of logistics

We help parents with:

Health and dental plan for children at no extra cost
6-month maternity leave and 20-day paternity leave
Daycare allowance of R$ 457 per child up to 5 years of age

Some of our offices also have:

Massage, manicure, pedicure at reduced costs
Pet day
Game rooms with video games, pool and others
Locker room and spaces to store your bike or scooter safely
Marketplace selling quick meals, drinks and snacks

_ Our culture


Inclusive, determined and visionary: that's who we are and how we work here.

We are already more than 1000 Loggers. We are hi-tech, little conservative and we are always up to date! Above all, we hope that everyone is eager to learn and acquire new knowledge quickly.

We look for an increasingly inspiring and welcoming work environment, and we very much hope that you will help us to maintain our culture even at an accelerated pace of growth.

We are very happy to be recognized among the best startups to work according to LinkedIn and Glassdoor, among the 10 most innovative startups by Forbes Brasil and also to be certified by Great Place to Work.

A empresa

A compra de um imóvel é a transação financeira mais importante na vida das pessoas, porém, é uma das transações mais complicadas e ineficientes que existem. Consumidores precisam lidar com serviços de baixa qualidade, falta de transparência e informação, documentação complexa, falta de segurança e diversas outras dificuldades.

A EmCasa nasceu para resolver estes problemas e transformar a experiência de comprar e vender um imóvel no país. Nós usamos tecnologia, ciência de dados e um modelo de negócios inovador e focado no cliente para redefinir o mercado imobiliário em favor dos compradores e proprietários de imóveis.

Nossa missão

Nossa missão é guiar e apoiar as pessoas na transação financeira mais importante da vida delas (a compra ou venda de um imóvel), esteja ela buscando um imóvel novo ou usado, popular ou de alto padrão, pagando à vista, financiado, ou até mesmo usando o seu imóvel na troca.

Nossos valores

Nosso time vive e transpira alguns valores. Para nós, é um requisito que você tenha grande fit com eles:

Nosso foco está no cliente
Nós agimos como donos
Nós somos humildes
Nós valorizamos a simplicidade
Nós temos senso de urgência
Nós colaboramos em equipe
Nós celebramos as diferenças
Nós promovemos a excelência

Responsabilidades e atribuições
Você fará parte do time que arquiteta as soluções de produto e tecnologia da EmCasa. Isso envolve nossos produtos para nossos clientes e os produtos internos que desenvolvemos para nosso time.

O time de produto da EmCasa é composto por Product Managers, Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Business Analysts e Product Designers - como Software Engineer você será responsável pelas decisões técnicas do time, e também será peça fundamental nas decisões de produto.

O nosso papel é transformar a experiência de compra e venda de ponta a ponta - para isso, o nosso time influencia totalmente na jornada dos nossos clientes e também em processos internos.

Trabalhamos com diversas tecnologias para resolver nossos problemas e desafios. Nosso código é escrito em Elixir, Python e JavaScript; nossa infraestrutura funciona na AWS; utilizamos PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch e DynamoDB; temos um PWA, e nosso frontend usa React, GraphQL e server-side rendering; desenvolvemos o nosso próprio AVM e temos diversos data-products em produção que são cruciais para o negócio; para dados, utilizamos Amplitude para comportamento dos usuários, e Looker para todas as análises de negócio.

Requisitos e qualificações
Se inscreva se você:

Possui 3+ anos de experiência em desenvolvimento de software, independente da linguagem ou tecnologia
Tem bom conhecimento de algoritmos e estruturas de dados
Tem experiência em trabalhar de maneira colaborativa, com outros engenheiros, product managers e designers
Sabe trabalhar com autonomia
Resolve problemas de forma analítica

Informações adicionais

The database market is massive (the IDC estimates it to be $89B+ by 2024!) and MongoDB is at the head of its disruption. The MongoDB community is transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.

The Full Stack Engineer of Go-to-market (GTM) operations plays a unique role within the greater go-to-market operations team by driving the effectiveness and efficiency of our customer-facing teams through the best use of technology. This engineer will be responsible for coming up with solutions to business problems around integrations, data ingestion, and transformation.

In this role, you will collaborate with key internal partners and apply your technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development. The successful candidate will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.

About the role
Implement custom integrations and data streams across internal business systems (Marketing software, data warehouse, Salesforce, etc)
Manipulate and transform data as needed from the business teams
Build a large-scale batch and real-time platform that will make data pipelines seamless and scalable for GTM teams
Help drive optimization, testing, and tools to improve the business systems
Collaborate with other software engineers across the company to accelerate the growth of the business and remove the data silos
Implement internal front end applications to expose data or control workflows
What success looks like
Working closely to the business using your technical expertise to build creative solutions for the business problems presented
Partnering with internal teams and leveraging their skills and tools to deliver the best solutions
Successfully help hire and train an exceptional team that can deliver fast with a high quality
The Go-to-Market (GTM) team sees you as a source our knowledge of our internal systems and a lead to organize and create technical solutions involving integrations, data management and workflows
The candidate for this position should possess
Experience with enterprise business systems such as Salesforce, Tableau, Data warehousing, Marketing Automation (Eloqua)
AWS services such as EMR, Lambda, S3, Athena, Glue, IAM, RDS, etc.
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
Ability to build batch and streaming data pipelines with tools such as Spark, Airflow, and cloud-based data services like Google's BigQuery, Dataproc, and Pub/Sub
Experience developing processes for automating, testing, and deploying your work
Several programming languages (Python, Scala, Java, etc.)
At least 2 years of experience working in Apex Programming, Visual force, controllers, triggers, batch processes, APIs and web services.
Good understanding of best practices of coding standards
A diverse set of databases like MongoDB, Cassandra, Redshift, Postgres, etc.
Different storage formats such as Parquet, Avro, Arrow, and JSON
Git and Github
CI/CD Pipelines
Fluent English

Job Title: Product Manager Consultant - Data Science Operations and Platform
Job Description:
Product Manager Consultant - Data Science Operations and Platform

Join us as a Product Manager Consultant on our Data Science Operations and Platform team in Brazil to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve


Our data scientists & engineers are helping to shape our marketing strategy for a digital world. The algorithms we build touch all customer segments – consumer, small business, commercial & enterprise. Across the model life cycle we do things at scale, few examples:

1. Feature engineering – Our data sets are 900M x 2K columns. We use spark on Hadoop – we want to make it faster. We also want our team to share features and use the same pipe for train & inference – do we need a feature store?

2. Model train – We use Python & R and we train models on R740 - VMs each with 4 Tesla V100s GPUs. We want to reduce train time, how do we parallelize training for non-deep learning models?

3. Model inferencing – We deploy models in production through containers. Our model output (inferences) are used to drive batch / offline marketing campaigns / operations. We want enterprise app to access model through APIs. We need sub millisecond inferencing – what does the API stack looks like?

Do you want to build the ML/AI platform that addresses these challenges?

We are looking for a passionate (fast learner) Product Manager to help build next generation ML-AI platform that powers our business. We offer you a fast-paced work environment in a diverse team with exposure to Dell teams across the globe. You will be part of a dynamic, collaborative and cross-functional team focused on making significant business impacts.

You will:
Full ownership of the product, the prioritization of new features and enhancements to existing features and comfortable & passionate about working with Big Data & data Science technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Cassandra and Kubernetes etc.)
Interact with business, platform and Data Science engineering teams to define and deliver new and innovative solutions and products, as well as drive improvements to existing data Science platform and products
Be the Technical authority in the program guiding the Engineering teams and providing updates on development progress and technical issue resolution to the upper management for infrastructure related enhancements and issues for data Science teams.
Define, communicate and measure success metrics for the customer engagement data science platform
Proposes multiple potential solutions for complex or new problems or processes and makes recommendations as to which direction should be taken.
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements
Solid experience in technology relating to design, test or quality and hands-on Experience with Data science and Big data technologies
Experience as a Data Scientist or experience as a technical product manager, working very closely with Data Scientists on Big data, database management, and Enterprise software products
Experience in the enterprise technology domain, such as Cloud technologies, open source, and analytics
A deep understanding of business goals and objectives and excellent understanding of the market and the products, as well as potential partner relationships for the product
Strong leadership skills for driving and collaborating cross functional groups
Desirable Requirements
A graduate degree in CS or Engineering and prior software development experience, especially with highly scalable and distributed systems
Exposure to machine learning, data mining or data analytics products and solutions
Here’s our story; now tell us yours

Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Application closing date: 01 Feb 2021.

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Dentro da maior empresa imobiliária do país, com mais de 80 anos de história, temos uma oportunidade incrível, num projeto de transformação digital, com total autonomia de trabalho.

Que tal fazer parte do maior e mais tradicional grupo de intermediação imobiliária do país?

Nosso propósito é ajudar as pessoas a conquistarem o seu lugar! ❤️

Estamos em busca de uma pessoa Data Engineer Specialist/Lead, apaixonada por Tecnologia, para contribuir com o projeto.

Usamos o poder do digital para entregar melhores produtos e experiências para nossos clientes (cliente final, incorporadora, proprietário, corretor e franqueado) que trarão resultados relevantes e muito valor para a Lopes.

Identificou-se com nosso propósito? Junta-se a nós!

Responsabilidades e atribuições

- Contribuir na visão de longo prazo das práticas de governança de dados.

- Trabalhar com problemas envolvendo muitos dados, com fontes diversas, com alta confiabilidade.

- Desenvolver algoritmos distribuídos processando e armazenando dados em streaming e batch.

- Ser responsável em manter os datasets mais críticos, sempre com alta qualidade.

- Identificar, desenhar e automatizar processos internos, através do desenvolvimento de data pipelines e frameworks.

- Desenvolver códigos para consumo de APIs, incluindo data streaming.

- Desenvolver crawlers/robôs para coleta de fontes externas e redes sociais.

Requisitos e qualificações

- Experiência avançada com Python, Scala e/ou Java.

- Experiência com Shell.

- Experiência com SQL .

- Experiência avançada em arquiteturas de Big Data (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Yarn, etc.)

- Experiência com ambiente Linux.

- Experiência com Kafka.

Desejável:

- Vivência em projetos ágeis.

- Experiência com Apache Airflow.

- Experiência com Cassandra e ElasticSearch.

- Experiência com produtização de modelos.

- Experiência com processamento de imagem.

- Experiência com NLP.

About Nubank


Tackling the complex banking system to empower people in one of the most bureaucratic markets in the world seems like a crazy idea, right? But that's why, how, and where Nubank was born. We fight complexity through our transparent and straightforward products and experiences: a no-fee credit card, a rewards program, a lending platform, and a digital savings account. In a nutshell, we are the most innovative tech company in Latin America, and we are obsessed with building financial services and products that make our customers love us fanatically. With over 23 million customers and $820 million raised in investment rounds, we are the fastest growing digital bank in the world, with offices in Brazil, Germany, Mexico, and Argentina. And it's still only Day One for us!

Engineering at Nubank

We strive for state-of-the-art software development practices, that currently includes a variety of technologies. While we value candidates that are familiar with them, we are also confident that software engineers who are interested in joining Nubank will be able to learn from our team.
Horizontally scalable microservices written mostly in Clojure, using Finagle and leveraging upon functional programming techniques and hexagonal architecture
High throughput jobs and inter-service communication using Kafka
Continuous Integration and Deployment into AWS
Storing data in Datomic and DynamoDB
Monitoring and observability with Prometheus
Running as much as possible in Kubernetes
We are a process-light organization that values human interactions. We value working in small, independent teams that feel like small startups within the company, and eschew coupling and centralizing where realistic. We understand that execution is the key to success and optimize processes to remove bottlenecks.

You can read more about it in our engineering blog and get some insights into how we work.

As a Software Engineer, you’re expected to:
Work with large scale distributed systems
Collaborate with building microservices
Have practical knowledge of agile software development methodologies
Work with continuous delivery and infrastructure as code
Benefits
Health, dental and life insurance
Meal allowance
Transportation assistance
30 days of paid vacation
Equity at Nubank
Parking partnership - discounted parking in our office
Free bike parking with showers available
NuCare - Our mental health and wellness assistance program
NuLanguage - Our language learning program
Gympass partnership
Extended maternity and paternity Leaves
Child care allowance
‘Espaço Feijão’- Private nursing and breastfeeding spaces in our buildings
Onsite Health Center - Medical support for every Nubanker in our office
Diversity and Inclusion at Nubank

We want to have a product for everyone, and we build strong and diverse teams that rise to the challenge. We are a team of the most creative people in technology, and we hire under equal opportunity, irrespective of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, or background. We are proud to say that 30% of Nubanker recognize themselves as part of the LGBTQ+ community, and 40% of our team comprises women in all positions and seniority levels. We are a very process-light organization that values human interactions, and that is an essential part of our culture. At Nubank, everyone has the opportunity to speak up and participate, grow, and share ideas.

Nubank continues to hire for all open roles, all interviewing and onboarding are done virtually due to COVID-19. Everyone new to the team and our current staff will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.

Cornershop es un servicio que te lleva el súper y distintas tiendas de especialidad, a tu casa o donde quieras, en una hora. Somos una de las Startups con mayor crecimiento en Latinoamérica: estamos en Chile, México, Perú, Colombia, Canadá, Brasil, Estados Unidos y Costa Rica.

Parte de nuestra misión es crear un servicio simple e intuitivo, que logre ser lo más automatizado posible y que, por lo mismo, logre escalar de forma orgánica. Los problemas los resolvemos a través de Software y nuestros equipos trabajan, piensan y hablan con y desde la tecnología.

En Cornershop nos estamos enfrentando a nuevos problemas relacionados al almacenamiento, procesamiento y utilización de grandes volúmenes de datos. El Data Engineer trabajará en el análisis, diseño e implementación de soluciones de Big Data junto a diferentes equipos para escalar múltiples aspectos de la organización. Estas soluciones requieren incluir diversas tecnologías y arquitecturas para filtrar, transformar y almacenar los datos de forma que ingenieros, data scientists y business intelligence analysts puedan utilizarlos sin importar la escala de estos.
¿Qué esperamos de ti?
Que te sientas cómodo planificando y ejecutando proyectos de ingeniería de software.
Que tengas proficiencia en el lenguaje de programación Python.
Que estés familiarizado con tecnologías Cloud (ocupamos AWS y Google Cloud).
Que tengas experiencia con bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales.
Que tengas experiencia en carga de datos utilizando procesos Batch y de Streaming.
Que tengas experiencia con tecnologías asociadas a soluciones de Big Data (Hadoop, Spark, Cassandra, HBase, Hive, Samza, Faust, Kafka, etc).
Te amaríamos más si
Tienes experiencia en la creación de Data Lakes y Data Warehouses.
Tienes experiencia en proyectos usando Java o Scala.
Que trabajes de forma proactiva, responsable y creativa
Abrazas la diversidad, la interculturalidad y seas tolerante
Te guste aprender constantemente no sólo sobre tu trabajo: que tengas un hobbie, te guste hacer cosas y seas un aporte positivo al equipo
¿Cómo serán tus primeros días?
Con la pandemia no solo hemos tenido que adaptarnos a la mascarilla, sino también a nuevos procesos internos. Últimamente nuestro crecimiento se ha acelerado en un 300% y trabajamos día a día para seguirle el ritmo, sin dejar de entregar la mejor experiencia a nuestros usuarios y a ti, que vienes a trabajar con nosotros.

Por ahora nuestros Onboarding y día a día son 100% remoto, para proteger la salud de todes (lo que no quiere decir que trabajaremos así para siempre, pero sí hasta que todas y todos puedan sentirse seguros al momento de salir y enfrentar las calles y aglomeraciones).

¿Cómo vamos a proceder?
- Recibirás tu contrato por email y podrás firmarlo digitalmente para que no tengas que salir.
- Recibirás en la puerta de tu casa tu computador y herramientas de trabajo que necesites.
- Tendrás una inducción con los distintos equipos con los que trabajarás.
- Serás invitado a una QA party (ya te explicaremos qué es eso) para participar en las mejoras de nuestro servicio.
- Para que no te sientas como el meme del perrito en el computador que dice "I have no idea what I'm doing", la primera semana agendaremos tu Onboarding (todo remoto por supuesto, así que puedes estar en pijama y nadie lo va a notar).

Nuestros beneficios:
Porque no todo es trabajo duro, también tenemos beneficios para que tus días en la oficina sean más amigables.
- Horarios flexibles, real
- Vacaciones adicionales
- Suscripción a Cornershop Pop para tus compras
- Seguro complementario de salud, vida y dental
- Actividades deportivas semanales
- Formación técnica: suscripción a plataforma con cursos, libros, certificaciones, etc
- Tech Talks informativas y formativas
- Y lo mejor de todo, trabajar y aprender con un equipo fuera de serie

Si quieres ser parte de un equipo profesional, respetuoso y diverso, donde te aseguramos que aprenderás mucho desarrollando esta software company, postula y las personas que escribieron esto se pondrán en contacto contigo.

Si quedaste con ganas de saber más de nosotros, puedes encontrar más detalles aquí:
https://medium.com/getonbrd/awesomecompanies-episodio-6-cornershop-8851c728d3e0
http://www.laclase.cl/

Digital
Senior Data Engineer - QuantumBlack

Bogota
Santiago

Apply Now

Qualifications

Degree educated in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent experience
Previous commercial experience in a data-driven role
Ability to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python, Scala, Java or similar languages
Knowledge of software engineering concepts and best practices
Familiarity with the latest OSS, cloud, container, query languages and database technologies
Confirmed experience building data pipelines in production and ability to work across structured, semi-structured and unstructured data
Experience preparing data for analytics and following a data science workflow
Commercial client-facing or senior stakeholder management experience
Strong command of English language (both verbal and written
Availability to travel

Who You'll Work With


You will be part of a Global Data Engineering community and you will work in cross-functional and Agile project teams alongside Project Managers, Data Scientists, other Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers and industry experts.

You will work hands in hands with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives

Who you are: You are a highly collaborative individual and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value. You have a sense of ownership and enjoy hands-on technical work. Our values resonate with yours.

What You'll Do

You will partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions

You will be flexible to travel to our clients’ offices to deliver presentations, gather information or share knowledge

You will contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client

You will design and build data pipelines to support data science projects, following software engineering best practices

You will use state of the art technologies to acquire, ingest, and transform big datasets

You will own and have accountability for the delivery of technical work streams

You will mentor and guide more junior colleagues

You will map data fields to hypotheses and curate, wrangle, and prepare data for use in advanced analytics models

You will ensure information security standards are maintained at all time

You will create and manage data environments in the Cloud or on premise

You will have the opportunity to contribute to R&D projects and internal asset development
OUR TECH STACK

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own OSS called Kedro, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure and more!



WHAT YOU’LL BENEFIT FROM

Real-World Impact – No project is ever the same, we work with top-tier clients across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.

Fusing Tech & Leadership – We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels.

Multidisciplinary Teamwork - Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.

Innovative Work Culture – Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.

Striving for Diversity – With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.

Continuous development and progression – We offer an extensive choice of training sessions, ranging from workshops to international conference, tailored to your needs as well as a personal mentorship system. We have multiple career paths and geographic locations to evolve within the Firm.

Global community – you'll learn from colleagues around the world by connecting both internally and externally through our various hosted meet-ups.

Visit our Careers site to watch our video and read about our interview processes and benefits.

Syngenta Group is one of the world’s leading agriculture innovation companies, with roots going back more than 250 years. Its 48,000 people across more than 100 countries strive to transform agriculture
through breakthrough products and technologies that play a vital role in enabling the food chain to feed the world safely, sustainably and with respect for our planet. Swiss headquartered and Chinese-owned,
the Group draws strength from its four business units – Syngenta Crop Protection headquartered in Switzerland, Syngenta Seeds headquartered in the United States, ADAMA headquartered in Israel, and Syngenta Group China – that provide industry-leading ways to serve customers everywhere.

Location: Arica, Chile

Make a difference:
You will be part of R&D team and will support Global Continuous Nurseries
Through the values Passion for customer, How Matters & Determined Execution you will live and experience more of us
Here is how this role will be critical to our business:
The Data Engineer will execute integration the various crops demands and will deliver Data & Analytics models including products and services (like Data Marts /MIO’s, dashboards, analytics and data pipelines).
Resulting into the optimized nursery design recommendation to achieve targets in each crop or program at the site including but not limited to:
Data collection, execution considering but not limited to; Lab Obs and controlled environments, Agronomy , crops (DH, TI, Nursery Sunflower, Peas and beans), operational cost (fix and variable)
Coordinate effectively with crop planners to recommend necessary adjustments to achieve targets in each program considering capacity vs demand.
Execute site wide data fluency projects
Focal point to operate using Agile methodology and expert within IT (SmartMart, Data Science, API’s and front-end solutions) to select the right fit for purpose and scalable solutions to increase efficiency, drive new revenues, gain strategic advantage for delivery and support business teams in making more informed and faster decisions.

At Syngenta Group we are highly people focused – we look for professionals who are engaged, collaborative and excellent in execution. Leaders are expected to communicate effectively, develop teams and lead by example. Our industry and our function are changing rapidly so we are looking for new team members with a strong desire to develop themselves.

Essential for this position:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in informatics, industrial processes, data modeling or computer science, or related D&A fields with 1-3 years of relevant experience.
• English intermediate/advance
• Experience in Cloud based ELT, Big Data tools, infrastructure, analytics and visualization
• Experience running Scrum/Agile development practice (ideally as product owner or scrum master).
• Proven track record in successful managing D&A and/or IT data delivery teams.
• Ability to manage supplier resources and handle escalations as needed;Experience in working in teams in an agile matrix organization

Be part of the Syngenta Group Experience
• Competitive salary and attractive benefits
• Dynamic and international environment
• Modern office environment and collaboration tools
• Forward thinking policies (e.g. remote working, career breaks)
• Support personal development in a diverse and inclusive environment

Important
Beyond just believing in the power of diversity, Syngenta Group promotes an inclusive culture that includes differences in all its forms. We believe that the feeling of belonging allows people to become their best version, building an increasingly welcoming and productive environment.
All qualified candidates will be considered for our positions, without distinction of race, gender, age, nationality or disability.


Be part of a leading company that brings plant potential to life
